double_jeopardy_round: TAKE ME OUT TO THE HISTORY GAME
THEY NAMED A FOOD FOR ME

(1, 1).clue: In 1885 the first successful vaccine for this was tested on a boy who had been bitten by a dog

(3, 1).clue: El Sol de Tehuacan, The Acapulco Times

(4, 1).clue: This type of sphere with a map of the Earth depicted on it has a name from the Latin for "sphere"

(5, 1).clue: This character has gone "Psycho" long before he says, "She might have fooled me, but she didn't fool my mother"

(6, 1).clue: According to an 1833 description, Poe dressed entirely in this color

(2, 2).clue: In 1990 United Brands changed its name to this to take advantage of its name recognition as a banana producer

(4, 2).clue: This kind of book is quite handy; it's name comes from the Latin for "hand"

(3, 3).clue: The Daily Punjab, The Balochistan Post

(4, 3).clue: If "You've Got" this flexible armor, you know its name comes from macula, a Latin word for "mesh of a net"

(6, 3).clue: In 1842 Poe reviewed this author's "Barnaby Rudge", which features (hmmm) a human-like raven

(2, 4).clue: Her red spoon logo was introduced in 1954 & now appears on more than 200 products

(6, 4).clue: Poe's wife, who passed away at age 24, had this name, like the state at whose university Poe studied

(2, 5).clue: In 1978 he was fired as the president of Ford, only to become the new president of Chrysler

(5, 5).clue: This Johnny Depp character tells his psychiatrist, "Don Octavio, you are a great lover like myself'

(1, 1).clue: Helen Frankenthaler's "soak and stain" technique was inspired by this artist's drip paintings

(2, 1).clue: To see this team's home games at FedEx Field, you can take a shuttle bus from the Landover, Md. Metro stop
